name: benevolent
meaning: well meaning and kindly.
example: a benevolent smile

name: serendipity
meaning: the occurrence and development of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way.
example: By serendipity, she found the perfect job.

name: quixotic
meaning: exceedingly idealistic; unrealistic and impractical.
example: a quixotic scheme to end world hunger

name: melancholy
meaning: a feeling of pensive sadness, with no obvious cause.
example: a deep melancholy settled over her

name: ubiquitous
meaning: present, appearing, or found everywhere.
example: the ubiquitous presence of the media

name: dilemma
meaning: a situation in which a difficult choice has to be made between two or more alternatives, especially equally undesirable ones.
example: She faced a dilemma: should she stay or should she go?

name: eloquent
meaning: fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.
example: an eloquent speech

name: intangible
meaning: unable to be touched or grasped; not having a physical presence.
example: the intangible qualities of a good teacher

name: cacophony
meaning: a harsh, discordant mixture of sounds.
example: a cacophony of noise from the city streets

name: ephemeral
meaning: lasting for a very short time.
example: the ephemeral joys of youth

name: enigma
meaning: a person or thing that is mysterious, puzzling, or difficult to understand.
example: Her disappearance remains an enigma.

name: meander
meaning: to follow a winding course.
example: The river meanders through the valley.

name: anachronism
meaning: a thing belonging or appropriate to a period other than that in which it exists, especially a person or thing that seems to belong to an earlier time.
example: The old steam engine was an anachronism in the modern factory.

name: symbiosis
meaning: interaction between two different organisms living in close physical association, typically to the advantage of both.
example: The relationship between bees and flowers is an example of symbiosis.

name: once in a blue moon
meaning: very rarely.
example: We only see each other once in a blue moon.

name: kick the bucket
meaning: to die.
example: He kicked the bucket last year.

name: lit
meaning: exciting, enjoyable, or impressive.
example: The party was lit!

name: callous
meaning: showing or having an insensitive and cruel disregard for others.
example: a callous disregard for human suffering

name: inscrutable
meaning: impossible to understand or interpret.
example: Her expression was inscrutable.

name: revere
meaning: to respect or admire greatly.
example: He was revered as a national hero.

name: ineffable
meaning: too great or extreme to be expressed or described in words.
example: The beauty of the sunset was ineffable.

name: peripatetic
meaning: traveling from place to place, especially working or living in various places for relatively short periods.
example: a peripatetic musician
